abstract: Mothers of two deceased former youth football players file class-action lawsuit against Pop Warner, largest youth football league in United States, claiming that organization put players in danger by ignoring risks of concussions; suit represents broadest challenge to youth football, as it also accuses USA Football, NFL's youth football arm, and group in charge of football helmet safety standards, of failing to protect young players.

headline.print_headline: Pop Warner Is Facing a Class-Action Lawsuit Over Concussions
headline.main: Pop Warner Is Facing a Class-Action Lawsuit Over Concussions

snippet: The suit is the biggest sign yet that youth football programs are the next front in the legal battle over head trauma....
lead_paragraph: The suit is the biggest sign yet that youth football programs are the next front in the legal battle over head trauma.
